Having organised the biggest repatriation in peacetime history by constructing a completely new &amp temporary Matterhorn Airline I'm determined that if a travel company goes bust in future we should be able to fly THEIR fleet to rescue stranded Brits.

Spent this morning with CAA watching the last flight of Operation Matterhorn Nearly 150,000 stranded passengers now repatriated Sincere thanks to the CAA teams across govt but especially to Thomas Cook staff who continued even after their firm's collapse THANK YOU

Motorcyclists represent just 1 of UK traffic yet account for 20 of fatalities Many killed sustain head injuries so better helmets vital SHARP rating scheme provides essential guide &amp has contributed to 39 decline in fatalities since 2008 Get details

Flights are departing throughout today to bring home the final passengers in the Operation Matterhorn programme Around 140,000 Thomas Cook passengers have been flown home during this huge repatriation using 150 aircraft as part of the Matterhorn fleet.
RT @transportgovuk The collapse of Thomas Cook posed an unprecedented challenge We‚Äôve worked 24/7 to successfully repatriate 130k people.‚Ä¶

THREE days remain of Operation Matterhorn with up to 14,000 Thomas Cook passengers left to return Around 132,000 flown back to UK in the first eleven days of the operation using more than 140 aircraft ‚úàÔ∏è
Operation Matterhorn has now brought home 127,000 Thomas Cook passengers using more than 130 aircraft The rescue operation continues until Sunday.

Pleased @HS2Ltd have confirmed all ancient woodland clearances scheduled to take place during Oakervee review will be paused Strikes a sensible balance between avoiding irreversible actions and causing unnecessary delays to the project if it continues
Over 120,000 Thomas Cook passengers are now back in the UK 30,000 more passengers due to continue their holidays before being repatriated this week.

We've now safely returned over THREE QUARTERS of Thomas Cook passengers to the UK in biggest peacetime repatriation For customers still abroad please fill out this form in case the CAA need to contact you about your flight.

Week two of Operation Matterhorn the largest peacetime repatriation in our history starts with TWO-THIRDS of Thomas Cook passengers (106,000 safely back in the UK.

Using more than 100 aircraft so far Operation Matterhorn has now returned 93,000 Thomas Cook passengers in six days The plan continues until next Sunday We will also return any stranded Thomas Cook staff.

Operation Matterhorn has now returned around half (76,000 Thomas Cook holidaymakers in the first five days of the rescue The plan is to operate 76 flights today Saturday returning another 16,700 home.

LATEST UPDATE In the first four days of Operation Matterhorn we've flown home around 61,000 Thomas Cook passengers now over 40 of the total 150,000 people left stranded by the holiday company's collapse.

UPDATE DAY 3 We have now flown home around 46,000 people approximately 30 of total Thomas Cook holidaymakers Around 95 of people back to UK on their original day of departure TODAY Over 70 rescue flights planned repatriating around 17k more people if all goes to plan.
Although I wasn't aware that some of these words had been used before the message in my statement stands true and I will follow through by delivering airline administration reform

Our repatriation programme includes passengers with both ATOL &amp non-ATOL protected flights We will get you home However 45 aircraft are in different configurations to original planes so it's a complex programme If away with Thomas Cook please go to

Very sadly Thomas Cook has collapsed The biggest UK peacetime repatriation in history is underway We will bring everyone home An enormous task there will be some delays but we're working round the clock to do everything we can Visit for details.
